claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: Title page of an original article titled 'Recombinant or Standard-Dose Influenza Vaccine in Adults under 65 Years of Age' with a list of authors. The image only displays the article title and authors and does not support the claim about mutations in cell- and egg-based flu vaccines during production. Note: Limited view of only the title page; no substantive content on vaccine production or effectiveness is visible.
